description: Open guard with outside leg hook behind opponent's lead leg knee created by Ricardo De La Riva
key_points: Hook outside leg behind opponent's lead knee|Control same-side ankle with hand|Opposite hand controls collar or sleeve|Maintain hip angle toward hooked leg
common_mistakes: Weak hook|No ankle control|Flat hips|Poor sleeve grip

description: Fundamental DLR sweep extending hooked leg while controlling ankle and sleeve
key_points: Establish DLR hook with sleeve and ankle control|Extend hooked leg to off-balance|Pull sleeve and push ankle|Follow to top position
common_mistakes: Poor controls|Insufficient extension|Not following|Weak hook

description: Inverting under opponent from DLR to spin to their back popularized by Mendes Brothers
key_points: From DLR, grip belt or pants|Invert underneath opponent's hips|Spin to take their back|Establish seatbelt and hooks
common_mistakes: Not inverting enough|Losing grips|Slow rotation|Poor timing

description: Transitioning from DLR to X-guard for different attack options
key_points: From DLR when opponent steps back|Insert second leg behind far knee|Establish X-guard configuration|Attack with X-guard sweeps
common_mistakes: Slow transition|Losing DLR hook|Poor second leg placement|Exposed to pass

description: Inside leg hook around opponent's leg from opposite side of DLR excellent against knee slice
key_points: Hook inside leg around opponent's lead leg|Control at ankle or pants|Free foot on hip or pushing|Maintain active hips
common_mistakes: Flat hips|Weak hook|No upper body control|Passive position

description: Sweep from RDLR spinning under to take back or come to top
key_points: From RDLR, secure grips|Spin under opponent toward hooked leg|Come out to back or top|Establish control
common_mistakes: Not spinning deep enough|Losing hook|Poor grips|Slow execution

description: Spinning under from RDLR to take opponent's back named by Paulo Miyao
key_points: From RDLR, grip far collar or pants|Spin underneath opponent completely|Emerge behind them for back control|Establish seatbelt
common_mistakes: Insufficient spin|Losing grips|Not emerging behind|Getting stuck

description: Using RDLR to enter leg entanglement positions for leg attacks
key_points: From RDLR, control ankle|Sit through toward leg|Enter SLX or outside ashi|Attack with leg submissions
common_mistakes: Losing control|Poor entry angle|Not securing position|Exposed to pass

description: Gi guard controlling both sleeves with feet on biceps creating maximum distance
key_points: Control both sleeves at cuff|Place feet on biceps|Extend legs to create distance|Move hips constantly
common_mistakes: Loose grips|Feet slipping|Flat hips|Passive playing

description: Sweep from spider guard sending opponent overhead or to the side
key_points: From spider guard, control both sleeves|Load opponent onto feet|Extend and sweep overhead or lateral|Follow to top
common_mistakes: Feet slipping|Poor sleeve control|Insufficient loading|Not following

description: Setting up triangle choke from spider guard by pulling one arm while extending leg
key_points: From spider, pull one sleeve across body|Shoot hips up for triangle|Lock triangle configuration|Finish with angle and squeeze
common_mistakes: Arm not across|Poor timing|Loose triangle|Flat position

description: Spider guard variation wrapping leg around opponent's arm at bicep for strong control
key_points: Wrap leg around opponent's arm from outside|Control sleeve on same side|Other leg can push hip or spider|Maintain strong connection
common_mistakes: Loose wrap|No sleeve control|Flat position|Weak lasso

description: Sweep from lasso guard using wrapped leg and sleeve control to off-balance
key_points: From lasso, control sleeve tightly|Use lasso leg to manipulate opponent|Sweep toward lassoed arm side|Follow to top
common_mistakes: Loose lasso|Poor timing|Not following|Weak sleeve grip

description: Transitioning from lasso guard to omoplata shoulder lock
key_points: From lasso, release wrap over shoulder|Sit up securing arm|Apply forward pressure|Finish omoplata
common_mistakes: Not releasing cleanly|Poor transition|Opponent rolling|Loose control

description: Open guard controlling collar and sleeve with active foot on hip or bicep
key_points: Control collar with one hand|Control sleeve with other|Foot on hip or bicep|Constant hip movement
common_mistakes: Loose grips|Passive position|Flat hips|No foot activity

description: Sweep from collar sleeve guard sending opponent overhead or to side
key_points: From collar sleeve, load on foot|Pull collar and sleeve|Extend leg overhead|Follow to top
common_mistakes: Poor timing|Weak grips|Not loading opponent|Foot slipping

description: Setting up armbar from collar sleeve guard when arm is extended
key_points: From collar sleeve, control arm fully|Swing leg over face|Secure armbar position|Finish with hip extension
common_mistakes: Arm not controlled|Slow transition|Loose legs|Poor angle

description: Using collar sleeve to spin under and take the back
key_points: From collar sleeve, arm drag motion|Spin under while maintaining grips|Emerge behind opponent|Establish seatbelt
common_mistakes: Losing grips|Not spinning deep|Slow transition|Poor timing

description: Sitting guard with both feet hooked inside opponent's thighs popularized by Marcelo Garcia
key_points: Sit facing opponent with feet inside thighs|Control with underhook and overhook|Maintain upright posture|Ready to sweep either direction
common_mistakes: Flat on back|Hooks too shallow|No upper control|Passive

description: Fundamental butterfly sweep using hooks and upper body control to elevate and sweep
key_points: Control with underhook and collar/overhook|Lean toward overhook side|Elevate with hook on underhook side|Follow to top
common_mistakes: Insufficient lean|Weak hook|No upper control|Not following

description: Using arm drag from butterfly guard to take opponent's back
key_points: From butterfly, grip wrist and tricep|Drag arm across your body|Get behind opponent quickly|Establish back control
common_mistakes: Not clearing arm|Slow movement|Losing hooks|Not following

description: Open guard with one leg behind opponent's knee and other pushing hip isolating their leg
key_points: One foot behind opponent's knee (inside)|Other foot pushing on far hip|Control ankle with hands|Maintain X configuration
common_mistakes: Poor foot placement|No ankle control|Flat position|Weak X

description: Classic X-guard sweep standing up while controlling opponent's leg
key_points: From X-guard, elevate opponent|Technical stand while holding ankle|Push hip foot to knock down|Come to top position
common_mistakes: Not standing up|Losing ankle|Poor balance|Slow execution

description: Sweep from X-guard by extending both legs while controlling ankle to dump opponent
key_points: From X-guard, control ankle tightly|Extend both legs simultaneously|Direct opponent's fall to side|Follow to top
common_mistakes: Weak ankle grip|Poor timing|Not following|Losing X position

description: Open guard isolating single leg with inside hook and hip push foundation for leg locks
key_points: Inside foot hooks behind knee|Outside foot pushes hip|Hips tight to opponent's leg|Control at ankle
common_mistakes: Loose hips|Poor hook|No hip push|Ankle not controlled

description: Transitioning from SLX to take opponent's back when they turn away
key_points: From SLX when opponent turns|Climb up their back|Insert hooks|Establish seatbelt control
common_mistakes: Losing leg control|Not following|Poor timing|Slow transition

description: Sweep from SLX by elevating and off-balancing opponent
key_points: From SLX, control ankle|Elevate with hooks|Push hip while controlling leg|Follow to top or leg lock
common_mistakes: Weak control|Poor elevation|Not following|Losing position

description: Variation of butterfly sweep emphasizing the elevation with hook under opponent
key_points: From butterfly, secure underhook|Place hook deep under opponent|Elevate dramatically while sweeping|Follow momentum to top
common_mistakes: Shallow hook|No underhook|Poor timing|Not following

description: Equal leg entanglement where both fighters have symmetrical position on each other's leg
key_points: Both fighters have leg triangle|Hips facing each other|Control at ankle|Position is symmetrical
common_mistakes: Loose triangle|Poor hip position|No ankle control|Passive position

description: Sweep from 50/50 using off-balance and momentum to come to top
key_points: From 50/50, off-balance opponent|Use momentum to sweep|Come to top maintaining entanglement|Transition to pass or attack
common_mistakes: Poor timing|Losing entanglement|Not following|Slow execution

description: Keenan Cornelius guard extracting opponent's lapel and wrapping around your shin
key_points: Extract opponent's far lapel|Pass under their leg|Wrap around your shin and grip|Create strong connection
common_mistakes: Poor lapel grip|Not wrapping correctly|Loose connection|Low energy guard

description: Sweep from worm guard using lapel connection to off-balance
key_points: From worm guard, secure lapel tightly|Off-balance opponent laterally|Sweep using connection|Follow to top
common_mistakes: Loose lapel|Poor timing|Not following|Weak connection

description: Using worm guard to spin to opponent's back
key_points: From worm guard, begin berimbolo motion|Use lapel to assist rotation|Spin to back|Establish control
common_mistakes: Losing lapel|Not spinning fully|Poor timing|Weak grips

description: Worm guard variation with different lapel path created by Keenan Cornelius
key_points: Extract lapel differently than standard worm|Create alternative connection|Attack from this configuration|Chain to other lapel guards
common_mistakes: Loose connection|Wrong lapel path|Poor position|Weak grips

description: Another Keenan Cornelius lapel guard variation with specific lapel configuration
key_points: Specific lapel extraction and wrap|Creates unique control|Enables specific attacks|Chain to worm system
common_mistakes: Incorrect lapel path|Loose grip|Poor position|Complexity errors

description: Eddie Bravo flexible guard pulling own ankle behind opponent's head from closed guard
key_points: Pull own ankle behind opponent's head|Control shin with same-side hand|Maintain broken posture|Attack omoplata or gogoplata
common_mistakes: Insufficient flexibility|Losing position|Poor control|Not breaking posture

description: Attacking omoplata from rubber guard/mission control position
key_points: From rubber guard, release to omoplata|Secure arm and sit up|Apply forward pressure|Finish omoplata
common_mistakes: Not transitioning smoothly|Losing control|Opponent rolling|Poor finish

description: Active seated guard position facing opponent ready for butterfly or other attacks
key_points: Sit facing opponent|Light hooks or feet ready|Hand fighting actively|Ready to engage any guard
common_mistakes: Too far|No engagement|Passive position|Flat posture

description: Open guard variation with shin-to-shin contact controlling opponent's leg
key_points: Place shin across opponent's shin|Control at ankle and sleeve/collar|Maintain connection|Ready for single leg or sweep
common_mistakes: Loose connection|Poor grips|Flat position|No activity

description: Taking single leg from shin-to-shin guard position
key_points: From shin-to-shin, grip around leg|Stand up with single leg|Finish single leg takedown|Come to top position
common_mistakes: Loose grip|Not following|Poor stand-up|Telegraphing

description: Inverted guard variation used for sweeps and back takes
key_points: Invert with leg hooked|Maintain control on opponent|Use inversion for sweep or back take|Flow between positions
common_mistakes: Losing control|Stuck inverted|No activity|Exposed to pass

description: Counter sweep when opponent attempts leg drag from your DLR guard
key_points: When opponent attempts leg drag|Use their momentum|Counter sweep to top|Maintain DLR structure
common_mistakes: Too late|Losing DLR|Poor timing|Not following

description: Combining spider guard on one side with lasso on other for maximum control
key_points: Spider foot on one bicep|Lasso wrap on other arm|Control both sleeves|Maximum distance and control
common_mistakes: Loose grips|Poor configuration|Flat position|No activity

description: Lachlan Giles modification of SLX for easier leg lock entries
key_points: Modified SLX position|Knee line across opponent|Easy entry to heel hook|Used in competition extensively
common_mistakes: Poor knee position|Losing control|Exposed to pass|Wrong configuration

description: Taking back from spider guard by spinning under opponent
key_points: From spider guard, release and spin|Go underneath opponent|Emerge behind for back take|Establish control
common_mistakes: Losing grips|Not spinning fully|Poor timing|Stuck under
